data.title: WORLD SCREEN
data.text:
Top Stories

ZDF Enterprises Buys Stake in British Factual Producer

ZDF Enterprises has signed a deal for a stake in the factual specialist World Media Rights, marking its first investment in a U.K. production company.

Top Stories

Three-Season Renewal for Top Gear France

RMC DÃ©couverte and BBC Worldwide France have renewed their agreement for seasons four, five and six of the French version of Top Gear.

Top Stories

New Development Exec at Authentic Entertainment

Authentic Entertainment has hired Sara Reddy, who has overseen such unscripted hits as Toddlers & Tiaras, as executive VP of development and current.

Top Stories

Omnia Media Opens Digital Production Studio

Omnia Media has launched its new digital production studio, which has been developing premium original short- and long-form content throughout 2017.

Top Stories

INK Global Names Master Toy Partner for Zafari

INK Global has tapped Hijinx as the master toy licensee for Zafari, an upcoming animated series created by David Dozoretz about a group of animal friends.

Top Stories

Argentina is Country of Honor at Inaugural Conecta FICTION

Conecta FICTION has revealed more details for its upcoming event, which will see Argentina as the inaugural Country of Honor.

Top Stories

PactUS & NPA Merge

The Nonfiction Producers Association (NPA) and PactUS have merged to create a new association, NPACT.

Top Stories

The History of Comedy Notches Up Global Deals

Cineflix Rights has taken on distribution for The History of Comedy, a new eight-part series from Turner, and has already closed a number of deals with broadcasters.

Top Stories

CBS Names Amy Reisenbach Head of Current Programs

Amy Reisenbach has been promoted to executive VP of current programs at CBS, succeeding Bridget Wiley, who announced plans to leave the network last week.
